Issues.Title: Question on React, Bulma App
Issues.Body:
I am having trouble with my bulma navbar - [Please see my Navbar in Github](https://github.com/gibdr7/the-up/tree/master/src/components/Nav)

### Desired behavior
* a navbar burger transition like [this site](https://www.moneycrashers.com/coronavirus-travel-restrictions-cancellation-policies/)
* a navbar-menu like [this site](https://www.moneycrashers.com/coronavirus-travel-restrictions-cancellation-policies/) (takes up whole page, menu-item-has-children has the nice dropdown arrow/effect)

### Actual behavior
* navbar disappears if I shrink the page too much
* dropdown only takes up part of the page
* children of menu-items display on top of other menu-items (with no dropdown arrow)

Issues.Title: Add multiple Sass tests
Issues.Body:
This PR improves the test script and allows a whole folder to be tested rather than a single file. This makes it easier to add even more custom Sass files in the future to check if they build correctly.

It also allows the Sass build to not fail if somehow a CSS variable is assigned to one of the Sass variables, like `$blue: var(--blue)` for example.

Issues.Title: Add `isActive` class for transparent sticky navbar (Very famous effect - see codepen)
Issues.Body:
**What? (Mix [transparent ](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/navbar/#transparent-navbar )& [fixed ](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/navbar/#fixed-navbar)navbar)**

## The problem:
For now, it's not so useful to use a **transparent** & **Sticky** **navbar**.
**Why?** Because when the user scrolls down the navbar should be with some solid background (Otherwise the navbar items **not** readable).  

### Example:
**Codepen example "how this should work" +-:**
https://codepen.io/ezra_siton/pen/jOPZgmR?editors=1010

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16711871/76539774-dda38600-6489-11ea-88d0-857a20df3116.png)

Give user an option to add data for `isActive`: `is-primary` and for `inActive`: `is-transparent`.
Than on scroll, the classes toggle = **very useful effect**. 

**CSS transition gives smooth transition (From transparent to solid and opposite):**
`  transition: background-color 0.5s ease;`

**Reference for this idea (From uikit framework):**
https://getuikit.com/docs/navbar#sticky-navbar
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add `isActive` class for transparent sticky navbar (Very famous effect - see codepen)" (#2871)

Issues.Title: Column class 'is-full-tablet' not respected
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**. It is a **bug**. ### Overview of the problem I'm using Bulma **version** 0.8.0 ### Description The `is-full-tablet` column class is not being respected when there is a top level size, such as `is-one-third` or `is-two-fifths`. ### Steps to Reproduce This is basic html that outlines the issue: ``` Hello Bulma!
Column 1
Column 2
``` ### Expected behavior Column 1 should fill the whole window once the window is < 1024px wide and Column 2 should disappear. ### Actual behavior Column 1 fills the whole window once the window is < 769px wide and Column 2 disappears when the window is < 1024px wide. ### Notes I am able to get my desired behaviour by setting Column 1's class to `"column is-full-mobile is-full-tablet is-one-third-desktop is-one-third-widescreen is-one-third-fullhd"`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Column class 'is-full-tablet' not respected" (#2837)

Issues.Title: Notification inside Hero may make Title & Subtitle unreadable
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** [0.8.0] My **browser** is: Chrome Version 80.0.3987.106 (Official Build) (64-bit). I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate** ### Description When embedding a Notification inside a Hero, the Title and Subtitle classes may not be readable. The Hero.Title and Hero.Subtitle colors override the Notification -- so when the Notification has a contrasting color to the Hero, the font colors are light/light or dark/dark instead of light/dark. ### Steps to Reproduce ```html

Title

Subtitle

Some content.

Title is legible

Subtitle is legible

Some content.

Title

Subtitle

Some content.

Title is not legible

Subtitle is not legible

Some content.

``` ### Expected behavior I would expect that the Title and Subtitle would be controlled by its surrounding Notification, not the parent Hero. ### Actual behavior Instead, the Title and Subtitle are impacted by the Hero.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Notification inside Hero may make Title & Subtitle unreadable" (#2825)
